intro: Psychotria fluminensis, commonly known as the Amazonian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers and elliptical, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Psychotria fluminensis is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as dimethyltryptamine (DMT).
